property.name: hive_server_host
property.description: Host where HiveServer2 is running. If Kerberos security is enabled, use fully-qualified domain name (FQDN)

property.name: hive_server_port
property.description: Port where HiveServer2 Thrift server runs on.

property.name: hive_conf_dir
property.description: Hive configuration directory, where hive-site.xml is located

property.name: server_conn_timeout
property.description: Timeout in seconds for thrift calls to Hive service

property.name: use_get_log_api
property.description: Choose whether to use the old GetLog() thrift call from before Hive 0.14 to retrieve the logs. If false, use the FetchResults() thrift call from Hive 1.0 or more instead.

property.name: list_partitions_limit
property.description: Limit the number of partitions that can be listed

property.name: query_partitions_limit
property.description: The maximum number of partitions that will be included in the SELECT * LIMIT sample query for partitioned tables

property.name: download_cell_limit
property.description: A limit to the number of cells (rows * columns) that can be downloaded from a query (e.g. - 10K rows * 1K columns = 10M cells.)A value of -1 means there will be no limit

property.name: close_queries
property.description: Hue will try to close the Hive query when the user leaves the editor page. This will free all the query resources in HiveServer2, but also make its results inaccessible

property.name: thrift_version
property.description: Thrift version to use when communicating with HiveServer2. New column format is from version 7.

property.name: config_whitelist
property.description: A comma-separated list of white-listed Hive configuration properties that users are authorized to set

property.name: auth_username
property.description: Override the default desktop username and password of the hue user used for authentications with other services. Used for LDAP/PAM pass-through authentication.

property.name: ssl_validate
property.description: Choose whether Hue should validate certificates received from the server
